values:
The time has come for me to announce my news.

On 30th September, me and Scott will be taking a plane to visit this guy:

Here:

We are very happy! We'll also be out there for my 19th birthday! Just over 64 days to go til we're in Florida!

I made lots of pretty icons. Huge thanks go to for her tutorial on making these, read it here --> ChaosDream <--

         

  

Feel free to use the first lot but check with Scott before using any with him on or he'll shout at me!

This is an apology to everyone who reads this but is without an LJ.  Every post is now going to be friends locked as even stuff I'm posting innocently is being twisted by some parties to mean things it was never intended to.  I'm really sorry about this guys but I'm not having people twisting what I'm saying anymore.  I promise to keep you all informed of stuff by email and msn from now on.  Sorry.
xxx

Jeez this is my first day living here and I'm already getting post!  At least it was good post!
I have an interview at college!!!  Woohoo!
And my mother has sent me underwear and a nail file, she gets weirder day by day...

Tonight be my first night on the magical easytour.  I be muchly excited as it has been sounding truly wonderous.  Thanks to everyone who has called and texted from the previous gigs to keep me informed of their happenings.
Tonight I'm bringing along 2 friends for their initiation into Easyworld.  I prey this is a good gig to introduce them.  Especially as this is only the 3rd gig one of them's ever been to!  I'm also hugely impressed by the 360 degree rotating piccy on the easyworld site ( www.easyworldinfo.com .)  Would be better if you could see Glenneth though! :op

This weekend I've been at my old friend Merran's house in Glossop (a small town in the middle of nowhere, well the Peak District.)  There was much madness including buying a new dog called Storm who lives up to his name.  This makes 3 golden retreivers they have in their not-so-large house, well they had 4 a few years back!  We mainly sat watching videos, tv, dvds and playing her playstation 2.  I love Spyro!!!  I am also now the proud owner of a copy of "Forever Delayed" the Manics photo book which is making me very happy.

I've now TEMPORARILY moved in with Scott.  So if you wanna post me stuff for any reason use his address.  This is til I get the money etc to get my own place up here.  Talk about the best friend you could possibly ask for!!!!!  And just to back him up on what he posted on his Livejournal, no we are not a couple!
Love you all,
xxx

I have flu.
It's horrid.
Meh.

In one hour's time my friend's plane lands at Luton Airport.  He is coming over from Amsterdam til Tuesday to see me, Kate and many other people off the Catboard.  It's gonna be fun but very weird I imagine as I've known him many many years but today is my first time meeting him.

As a result I won't be on here much til Tuesday so speak to you all then (except for a few people who I'll talk to/see this weekend.)

I'd better go make my hair look half decent, gotta make a good first impression!
xxx

The funniest, cutest thing in the world just happened!
I was sat talking to Nicky on msn and Scott was reading Harry Potter when I noticed movement in the corner of my eye.  Looking over I saw a large spider crawling along the wall.  I gasped out of suprise and Scott asked what was wrong.  I told him there was a spider and he leapt up onto the sofa looking for it.  I found it and asked if Scott was ok, he said he would be provided the thing stayed in the corner and didn't move.  About a minute later I saw it run into the centre of the room, I told Scott and he leapt onto the sofa and stood there looking terrified.  I asked if he wanted me to get rid of it, he went bright red and said yes.  So I got him to open the backdoor and then he looked at the spider and went and hid in the downstairs loo while I took it into the back garden with the help of a letter and a glass.  When I came back in he was stood in the lounge looking extrememly embarassed!  Cute beyond words!!!!!

This is a genuine psychological test. With some very interesting results.

It is a story about a girl. While at the funeral of her own mother, she met this guy whom she did not know. She thought this guy was amazing, totally her dream guy, she fell in love with him right then and there but never asked for his number and could not find him. A few days later, the girl killed her own sister.

Question: What is her motive in killing her sister?

<LJ-cut text="Answer, don't read this until you've come up with an answer to the question.">

Answer: She was hoping that the guy would appear at the funeral again. If you answered this correctly, you think like a psychopath. This was a test by a famous American psychologist used to test if one has the same mentality as a killer. Many arrested serial killers took part in this test and answered it correctly. If you didn't answer correctly - good for you. If your friends hit the jackpot, may I suggest that you keep your distance. (If you got the answer correct, please let me know so I can take you off my e-mail list......unless that will tick you off, then I'll just be extra nice to you from now on!)

Just so you know, I got it wrong!
</LJ-cut>

Today I am nursing a collection of painful injuries.  And no I didn't get them as Nicky suggested by having a "night in with Scott."  Last night I saw the wondrous Kinesis at their "secret" Manchester show along with Scott, Dale, Sean and their friend Alex(I think that was her name.)  That moshpit was the most violent and hot I've ever been in.  By the end of the night we were dripping sweat (the ink on Sean's t-shirt had run so much all the writing had blurred almost beyond recognition.)  Only me, Sean and Alex went into the moshpit, Scott and Dale stayed at the back.  So far back Scott couldn't even see the stage so he sat through the set on a random chair.  How Dale saw anything amazes me, I imagine he stood on the spare amp at the back.  I had to go home and get a shower before Scott would even let me in the bed!  You can't see any bruises but my head is killing me cos I was kicked there several times and had my head slammed into a pillar a few times too.  However, it was worth it!  Definately one of the best gigs I've ever been to and I survived the mosh pit to get on the front row about halfway through the set.  Shame the support act, Miss Black America, were so bad but their set gave me time to read the mini Kinesis fanzine that the band had produced.  I didn't bother trying to talk to the band cos everytime I saw them they were surrounded by adoring fans clamouring for autographs.  I got a big smile and a wave from Conor though which was nice cos I thought he would have forgotten me by now.  Tom, Neil and Micheal obviously recognised me but couldn't place where they knew me from.  hehe.  Anyways will stop ranting now and instead show you the best pictures.  I've got some more, if you want them just ask.
http://www.villagephotos.com/pubbrowse.asp?selected=317364
<LJ-cut text="And a Quiz Stolen from Nikki">
RED
What is love? It's different for everyone.  You just know when you feel it.
Name 3 things you feel very passionate about: My friends, music, my Neice.
Does fire fascinate you? In a morbid way, it scraes me too.
Do you have a short temper? Only with a few people.
Are you a friend to dragons? Yes, I have a pet one called Andre.
Are you very warm hearted? I hope so.
Do you feel intense emotions? Yes.
ORANGE
Are you bright? No.
What are the three most wholesome things you've done lately? Made choccy biccy things, done the laundry and made my dinner.
Is vibrance a good characteristic to have? Yes.
Are you rich in self confidence? No way!
Are you rich in vitamin c? Not right now, no fruit in this house.
Is lala orange your favorite rainbow bright character? Never watched Rainbow Brite *avoids things being thrown by Fleur*
YELLOW
Are you a very happy person? Sometimes.
Do you like the sun? Yes.
Do you ever feel utter and complete joy? Rarely.
Do you feel like the volume in your life is all the way up? No.
Do you feel warm inside when you hug people? Depends on who I'm hugging.
If you were a care bear would you be cheer bear? I doubt it.
Are you lemon scented? No.
GREEN
Are you incredibly lucky? Sometimes I seem to be.
Are you easy going? Mostly.
Are you very mischievious? Oh yes, very!
Are you very lusty/sexy? People seem to think it, I'm not one of them.
Ever find a four leafed clover? No.
Are you fresh like mint? When I've just got out of the shower.
Does nature speak to you? Sometimes.
BLUE
Do you love to look at water? Yes, especially the sea.
Are you calm/relaxed? Not very often.
Is it very difficult to upset you? No, it's very easy.
Are you at peace? No.
Are you comforting? I hope so.
Are you well balanced? Hahaha
Are you content? Right now I am.  Well, I'd be a bit more if my head didn't hurt.
PURPLE
Are you royalty? Not that I know of.
Are you very free spirited? Yes.
Are you conceited? Hope not.
Do you have a passion for indulgence? Sometimes.
Are you a grape? No one's ever mentioned it if I am.
Are you a purple horseshoe? Again, not that I'm aware of.
PINK
Are you less than intense? I think so.
Are you incredibly feminine? I can be.
BLACK
Do you absorb everything possible? I try to absorb all the knowledge I can.
Are you incredibly energetic? Only on occasions ;)
GOLD 
Are you expensive? Ask Scott.
Are you worth it? See the last answer.
</Lj-cut>
Ps, I just got 127 on an IQ test, my friend Colin who just left uni got 124.  He's devastated.  hehehe

Shame I can't take good pics to show you all how gorgeous the views here are and how beautifully sunny it is. In case you're wondering this was taken from Scott's front bedroom window. You just can't get the prettyness of the back view in a picture, it just looks like a housing estate. xxx

Move over Nigella, Delia et al.
I'm the Kitchen Goddess now!

I'm about to get the coach to Leeds.
I'll be with Scotteth in 5 hours.
I am very happy.
xxx

I've been shopping. You don't care what I bought but I'm going to tell you anyway. I got my neice's birthday card, it has a teddy bear on it and pink glitter. I also got my coach ticket to Scott's for tomorrow. This makes me very happy indeed! Shelley bought me underwear. I got loads of knickers in Topshop which will keep me going for ages. She also bought me a matching set from Gossard which were expensive but gorgeous. I am an awkward bra size so I find it impossible to find matching underwear unless I buy it from "proper" bra shops. Especially as I refuse to wear thongs so even when I occasionally do find bras that fit the chances of them having matching knickers in my size that aren't thongs basically equals none. This equals expense but as Shelley understands I can only buy expensive stuff she's fine paying out every so often (plus it's not actually expensive to her as she has money!) Sadly we went shopping after Shelley had finished work so everywhere was shutting. This means I have to wait for the other stuff I was gonna get in Ann Summers (nothing kinky!) but I can do waiting, I wasn't even expecting to be able to get the stuff! After shopping we went for a drink and a cake at the nice little coffee shop in the hotel that most people don't know about so it's quiet. Luton can be nice when you know where to go! Now I'm hot and tired and should be revising but am watching the last episode of Buffy instead. I am so confused cos I haven't seen it all season. For instance, why is Xander wearing an eye patch? And why is Dawn being more of an annoying brat than normal? Hmmmmm
i am open-minded!

How indie are you? test by ridethefader
You're pretty knowledgeable about music in general. You like indie music, sure, but that's only part of it. You'll listen to any old shit as long as it sounds good to you. You're not snobby about music at all, you just like what you like. How boring. Curiously, this makes you popular with the opposite sex.

I just made this animated thingy.  This post is here to show it off to you all.  Scott is going to murder me when he sees it!

*ducks*

If anybody actually wants to know if Pippa's ok, we just got back.  Apparently she has an infection in her left eye.  I've been given eye drops that I have to put in 3 times a day, along with the ones I already had to put in twice a day.  This dog is small and wriggly, my black top is now white with all her hair.  And I've only done it once!  Ho hum, at least tommorrow Shelley will be back so she can help do it.  
How is it only 4pm?  I'm exhausted.  This is the slowest day I've experienced in ages!  
I've got the house to myself tonight as Karen's back in Southend, Kate's at Charley's and Shelley's at a ball in Newcastle.  If I knew anyone I'd throw a wild and raucous party but I don't so I shall sit in alone.  Scott's gonna call to keep me company and I have to call at least one other person tonight so this will keep me occupied for a few hours.  Add to that some decent tv programmes, making tea and looking after animals, I dout I'll have time to get bored or notice the lack of people.  But if you get bored tonight then give me a call!
xxx

Pippa (our dog) is all ill.  I have to take her to the vets this afternoon.  Her eye is all swollen and nasty.  I hope she's ok.

I had a good morning today.  My RS exam was stupidly easy.  Sample question I remember:
"Who do Christians believe is the Son of God?"
Silly silly exam.
xxx

I am ill. I am not happy about it. I have an exam tomorrow. I am not happy about this either. So I have decided that I am going to make myself happier. I am watching the Matrix, I forgot how damn sexy Neo is! Earlier I ate Haagen Daz belgian chocolate ice cream. It was lovely! Then I made Scott call me. He was quiet and tired but was happy and made me happy too. Scott always makes me feel much more relaxed and at ease, that's why I make sure I speak to him every night. Enough rambling, here, have some test results instead.
cuddle and a kiss on the forehead - you like to be
close to your special someone and feel warm,
comfortable, and needed

What Sign of Affection Are You?
brought to you by Quizilla
-Sensitive- You're Sensitive, and you'd like to
stay that way. Sorry,listened to a bit too much
Jewel there. You're sweet and very emotionally
charged. You definitely love the person you're
with, and always want to know how they're
feeling so you can make sure they're happy.

brought to you by Quizilla So now you know!
i love scott.  he is cool and rocks muchly :)

Isn't he adorable? Don't you just wanna take him home and cuddle him??? He will KILL me for putting this up so: Scott, you have permission to upload that godawful pic you took of me when I took this. xxx

I've gotta come up with a thing to replace my "registered user" name on the easyboard.  For non-boarders it's gotta be 15 characters or less. The word "user" will appear after it so you can integrate that into it.
Suggestions???
Nothing too filthy either! *looks at certain people*

Sometimes people really strike a chord of truth with something they put on LJ. Today, that honour goes to Relly. "scott, when it comes to nikki you are quite desperately pervy aren't you?" *hugs Relly, Nikki and Scott*

Yay!!!!!
I'm a happy bunny!
A VERY happy bunny!!!
The reason?
In my exam today there was 1 question on a topic I'd never been taught.  I left it to the end but had a few spare mins.  I decided to come up with something completely random to fill the space cos I'd always been taught that if you write something (even if you think it's bollocks and have no idea what you're on about) you're more likely to get marks than if you leave it blank.  So I rambled some complete shite for a few lines.
Just got back and am discussing the exam with Tom, my friend who knows scary amounts about science.  He told me that what I wrote was actually the right answer and that I should get at least 1 of the 2 points available!!!!
So there you go everyone, just ramble shite if you've got spare time!  You never know!
xxx

I feel more crap today than I have in months.  I hate being here.  I can't wait to move to Leeds.  Wish I could do it as soon as Joop goes home (July 2nd) but I have nowhere to live up there and no money.  I guess I'll have to resign myself to the fact that I'm stuck here until God knows when.  I wish Scott was here, he knows how to make everything seem much better.  Everyone here is just depressed, pissed off etc.  I'm forcing back tears as I write this because I have to be strong so I can do this exam and because I doubt anyone here would give a toss if I started crying cos they've all got problems.
I feel numb.  I want Scott.  NOW.

I haven't been on here in ages so long entry alert!
So yeah, the title sums it up really doesn't it?  But why??  I'll tell you!  On Thurs (not *technically* the weekend but, meh,) we saw Radiohead and they were ABSOLUTELY FUCKING STUNNING!  They played "No Surprises" which made me very very happy and their new single "There There" sounded amazing live.
<LJ-cut text="Setlist">
'There There' 
'2+2=5' 
'The National Anthem' 
'Morning Bell' 
'Lucky' 
'Backdrifts' 
'Sail To The Moon' 
'Sit Down. Stand Up' 
'Scatterbrain'

'No Surprises'

'Talk Show Host' 
'Fake Plastic Trees'
</LJ-cut>
On Saturday we went to town and sat in a pub to watch the Division 3 playoff final because Lincoln (Scott's team) were playing Bournemouth.  We lost 5 - 2 but seeing as how Lincoln can't afford to move up to division 2 it was probably for the best. :)  (Look at me acting as if I know what I'm talking about!)  In the evening Scott's parents came round and we watched Shrek on dvd which was fun as we all love that film.  Scott's mum and dad rock!  
On Sunday we all got up late and headed off to Ikea where such fabulous things as ice cream scoops, toilet role holders, lights and chairs were purchased.  We took a diversion on the way home and had a gorgeous roast dinner and the pub down the road.  Then we came home and vegged out in front of the sofa for the rest of the afternoon (with a nice bown of Carte D'or cookie ice cream I might add!)  Scott's parents headed off back to Lincoln around six and not long after me and Scott left for Pizza Hut.  One good meal later and we wandered into the cinema where we saw the Matrix Reloaded.  It was absolutely amazing but we both agreed that it took a while to get going and some of the fight scenes were a bit *too* long.  I'm definately going to see it again as I have very little idea what actually happened, it was tres confusing!
Monday came and again we woke late and quickly headed off up north to Middlesbrough.  We found Dale and Ali before going for some food (which we later regretted - it took ages and was pretty crap when it finally arrived.)  Then we set off for our first band, The Delays as recommended by Dawn.  They were very very good, Scott described them as "Busted if they played good music instead of that pop crap" or some such similar wording.  Next up were the Bandits who also rocked, soon followed by the Darkness who were definately one of the best bands there!  We saw Hope of the States (yay!) next who were beautiful if a little shocking (how many people do you *need* on stage at one time?)  Then we saw Biffy Clyro who were dire (sorry to all the Biffy fans but we just thought they were boring as hell.)  Last of all were Easyworld!!!!!  They were absolutely stunning and played the best rendition of Other Man I've ever heard.  Til the Day and Don't Expect were beautiful as ever and Bleach had the audience going mental!  Lastly we were treated to a new song called "When You Come Back I Won't Be Here", it too was amazing and made us desperate for more.  After the show we got to talk to the band etc for a good 2 hours.  Scott and Dav entertained us all with their double act, anyone who didn't know us must have thought they'd rehearsed it, it really was classic!  We heard many rumours... *cue spooky music* (no, I'm not gonna tell you, hehehe.)
Last night we summed off the excitement by seeing the 22-20s.  First band (possibly called Clearlake but we're not sure,) were ok.  Second on, The Blueskins were absolutely amazing and blew away everyone there!  After that the 22-20s were a bit of a downturn (and seemed to be in a bit of a strop too.)  They were ok but I don't see why the music press is kicking up such a fuss about them.
But yes, long entry.  Sorry :-)

<LJ-cut text="Gonna make It Even Longer Now!">
1.do you shave? yes.
2.what do you shave? legs, under-arms, bikini line if i'm going swimming (or seeing a nice boy ;) )
3.why? looks and feels nicer
4.what colour is your razor? they tend to be blue
5.what size is your bed? double
6.do you like it? it's ok, would prefer one without the single bunk above it
7.you're going on a date for a walk around the lake then a coffee at a cafe. what do you wear FROM your closet? my jeans and my "shagger shirt" green/white vertical stripes and much nicer than it sounds (great plunging neckline which a certain persona reading this seems to appreciate, not mentioning any names *coughs*mr brown*coughs*
8.Would you go naked in a bathtub with a naked old man/woman with each of you having a bar of soap and soap each other till the bars of soap run out for a million dollars? for a million I could probably do it
9.if you woke up one morning and found out you were going to stay in the body you have now for the rest of your life, what would you think? I could deal with that
10.letter or e-mail? I prefer letters but sometimes it's better to send emails
11.if world war III broke out, what would you say? I thought it already happened....
12.buttons or boxes? boxes
13.which 5 people do you trust and are open with the most? Scott, Karen, Tom, Rik, Merran
14.what's something a guy/girl will wear that'll turn you off? something garish or that really doesn't suit them
15.what's something a guy/girl will wear that'll turn you on? relatively tight clothes that they look good in.  erm... tops with "guaranteed to blow your mind" written on them in red glitter for instance...
16.what do you think of soulmates? I think I've found mine and i'm very happy about it!
17.florida or cali? florida, can't wait!
18.is the world screwed? yes
19.is cussing a necessity in life? yes
20.what's an object you can't live without? my phone
21.can you live without the microwave? easily
22.You have this uh, erotic dream about your friend of the opp. sex. how do you act and feel around that friend the next day? I'd tell them cos all my mates would find it funny!
23.would you rather be rich with 15 spoiled brats or just barely making it with a dog? barely making it but can I have a cat instead of a dog?
24. how's your schoolwork for you right now? I'm meant to be revising as we speak, I'll start when I've finished this!
25.what's something someone's done to make you hold a grudge against them? Be nasty to me and my friends.
26.Favorite weather? sunny and warm
27.what's one look trait that attracts you to a guy/girl? eyes, smile and hair
28.what's one personality trait that attracts you to a guy/girl? if I can trust them and be comfortable around them.  And if I can have a good laugh with them.
29.do you know what 143 means? no *feels stupid*  I've heard it before though...
30.who's phone number are you hoping to get? *feels REALLY embarassed* Frank...
31.describe melancholy, if you don't know, then skip this question. When I can't feel anything at all...
32.describe mellow. relaxed
33.do you believe in ghosts? why or why not? yes cos I've seen one
34.what time did you sleep last night? went to bed about midnight, slept about one
35.which guy/girl do you wish to be with RIGHT now? they know who they are
36.is it right to flirt if you have a bf/gf? i think it is providing the bf/gf is ok with it
37.would you rather be married in venice, italy, or honolulu, hawaii? *thinks really hard* probably Venice
38.would you rather eat sandwiches or pasta for the rest of your life? sandwiches, pasta is icky!
39.(guys) how would you feel if you gave a girl a flower? n/a.
(girls) how would you feel if you got a flower from a guy? I'd be really happy and feel loved.
40.do you want to drop school? no, cos I finished last week!  Just exams and revision left now
41.what do you think of the words, "no pain, no gain" ? true to an extent
42.what do you think of the quote "eyes are the passageways into the soul" ? definately
43.What do you think of sleep? depends who's asleep beside you, I hate sleeping alone
44.if you had the chance to slow down your growth now and live to 500 years but it's like a 50 year old body by then, would you go for it? Definately!!!!!!
45.at one point in a girl/guy friendship will one them them like each other even if it's only for a little bit. true or false? false
46.Are you a procrastinator? dunno, a bit probably
47.waffles or pancakes? potato waffles cos they go with so much!
48.how's your cereal in your bowl? I very rarely eat cereal but when i do it's just as it comes out the packet
49.what's an annoying trait about you? I constantly moan about things being wrong with my life.
50.football or rugby? rugby but footie aint that bad
51. hat or visor? hat
52.ice skating or rollerblading? neither, I have a fear of pain
53.(guys) your gf has long beautiful hair which you love, she comes to school the next day with a short crop cut. what do you HONESTLY think? n/a.
(girls) your bf has hair you love. he comes to school the next day with a shiny head. what do you HONESTLY think? It wouldn't bother me enough to do anything but I'd poke him lots.  
54.pizza or burgers? pizza.
55.what colour is your jacket? blue
56.what's something you ALWAYS have on you? my necklace
57.what do you think of guys with nailpolishes? very cute
58.do you stay in bed thinking or do you fall asleep in 5 seconds? depends on the day I've had, how tired I am and who else is in the bed ;)
59.would you rather go to a boarding school, private school, or an all girls or guys school? none, but my private school was better than the comp
60.there's a high school that'll be on a cruise ship and you have the opportunity to go. it's your last year at school. do you go for it? no, I couldn't cope with being away from some people
61.who do you want to take with you to the prom? I don't have a prom but I'd ask Scott
62.your bf/gf gets drunk at a party. in their state of drunkenness, they babble about that one time they fooled around with someone else while you were together. they wake up the next morning with a slight memory that did something stupid. what do you do? talk to them
63.is cyber sex considered cheating? yes
64.how do you react to change? depends on the change
65.are you happy? i'm ok and the moment, will be happier when my exams are over and when Scott's a bit happier
66.favorite berries? raspberries
67.what's one facial feature you'd like to change about yourself? make it thinner
68.do you take a shower after a bath? I only have showers, hate baths
69.what's colour's your towel? we have many colours!  mainly blue though
70.what do you think of knuckle cracking? doesn't bother me
71.what was the last thing you cried over or got teary about? something private yesterday
72.chalk or crayons? crayons
73.how's you happiness level right now? 0 (low)- 10 (high) 5, Scott's at work so I'm alone
74. coffee, tea, or me? well I hate coffee and tea so you I guess! 
75.wouldn't you just love to hug someone right now? yes! 
76.who was the last person who complimented you? Scott
77.what's wrong with your school? erm, everything???  seriously, crap teachers who can't control classes
78.do you know what an aphrodisiac is? yes
79.who do you wish you could kiss? Dav....
80.movies at home on in a theater? cinema, but Scott's home theatre system makes them pretty damn good here too
81.wanna live in a castle? if it was Hogwarts!
82.isn't gondola a cool word? I suppose so.

So finally, after countless years waiting, I'm seeing Radiohead tonight.  I can't wait!  Am going with Scott, it's his first time seeing them too so he is equally bouncy.  People I've spoken to who've already seen them this tour tell me they're amazing.  They've also been playing No Suprises which is one of the three songs I've been praying for; the other two are How to Disappear Completely and Planet Telex.  I'd love to hear Street Spirit too but apparently they don't play that one often and as for Creep... hahaha like there's a chance!
So today I've played most of the Radiohead albums.  I don't really like Kid A so I stopped that one halfway and I'm gonna ask Scott if we can play Hail to the Theif in the car on the way there.  We're meeting my old friend Colin at the venue, it'll be nice to see him again.
Away from Radiohead, Scott gave me a few pressies when I got here.  Namely the Bell X1 vinyl I asked him to grab me, an "easygirl" badge and a "whore" badge to go with my "junkie" one.  All shall of course be worn to Middlesbrough on Monday.  Another gig I'm *really* looking forward to.  Today I found out that Hope of the States, The Bandits and The Darkness are playing so I'll be dragging Scott along to them (though I feel I may be the one being dragged to HOTS!)  This adds to Easyworld who we were already seeing (obviously,) The Delays who we've been told to see and I'm hoping to catch the end of the Biffy Clyro set.  Saint Rose are playing but I wasn't that impressed with them supporting King Adora last year.  Also Keane are playing so I shall be avoiding the Play Stage when they're about (if you don't know, don't ask!)  I'd have liked to see Junior Senior and Reef but HOTS and Easyworld easily take pole position over them, oh well.
Ok, enough ranting for now, Scott's almost home so we'll soon be eating.
Love ever,
xxx
Surely this gets close to matching the cuteness???? Awwwwwwww!

I LOVE YOU LOADS BARRY AND SCOTT!!!!!!!!

Yes.  It's finally happened.  I'm not going to get into a long rant about how much they meant to me and how good they were etc cos it's not worth it.  All I will say is that I've been a Mansun fan for 7 years so you can imagine how much I've grown to love this band.  I'm simply grateful for the times I've got to see them play live, the music I've spent hours upon hours listening to and the chance I had to meet and talk to them.

~*~RIP Mansun~*~

One good thing has come of this however.  I texted my sister to tell her and she actually REPLIED!!!!  She hasn't replied to a text of mine all this year.  It's a small step, but a step forward nontheless.

I feel guilty cos I haven't done this in ages, so I'm being the first to do it today, hehe.  Just a quick update for you all too, I'm at Scott's today (again!) and our Radiohead tickets arrived this morning! *bounces* I can't wait!

You know that sinking feeling when you realise quite how much stuff you have to get done in a very short time???  I'm currently having it!

Tomorrow night I have an interview at a college in Manchester.  I'm not good in interviews, I tend to freeze up :(  Luckily I'm seeing friends afterwards so that should make it better.  
I have to apply for another college as I don't actually want to go to the Manchester one now, that's just there for backup.  Applying means getting references, predicted grades etc and... writing a personal statement!!!!  Bastards!
My first exam is 3 weeks today and I don't feel like I've done nearly enough revision!
I haven't even started flat hunting yet and I have to move up north in early September at the latest, preferably late August.
Tons of school stuff.
Although it's not vital, SPCAM hasn't been updated in ages and I feel terrible for not reviewing half the gigs I've been to recently and all the demos I've been given by various little bands who if I'm honest, desperately need the promotion!

Aaaargh stress!

Not updated much recently cos of lack of internet. Well I have it back now (yay!) so I can update. Spent last week doing many many fantabulous things. On Tuesday me and Scott went to Saltaire to have a look around. It's a small village so most people won't find it at all interesting but it was built by my great great (insert random number of "greats" here cos I'm not sure how many there are,) grandfather so I wanted to see what my family is responsile for! It was really lovely. We fed the ducks on the canal, had a look round the village and visited the David Hockney galleries in the old salt mill. All in all it was really enjoyable, Scott seemed to have a good time too which I was happy about cos I didn't think he'd be too pleased to have me drag him round some boring Yorkshire village. On Wednesday we drove down to Luton. We spoke to Shelley for an hour or so before getting ready and heading into London. I successfully navigated the tubes to Shepherds Bush and then we went for KFC and McMinis before heading to the Empire and settling into our seats with a drink. We had amazing seats. The support acts were really really good. Tom Baxtor and a Mexican couple with guitars. Damien on the other hand was ABSOLUTELY FUCKING STUNNING!!!!!!!! Definately the best concert I've ever been to! The old stereotype of something making you laugh and cry came true. The classic story of The Wee Boy who was Wee Bit Pissed Off came out and had us all crying laughing. A bit later I was crying properly at Cold Water (I don't think Scott noticed me sobbing - probably a good thing.) I honestly cannot believe how good that gig was, I doubt it will ever be surpassed! I also can't believe how much I love Scott for introducing me to the wonder of Damien! Thursday and we went to London in the morning. I took Scott to the Tate Modern in a vain effort to culture him - it didn't work. Instead I ended up giggling my way round it trying to stop him loudly commenting on how "that's not art - that's crap" and "I could do better than that!" Soooooo embarassing! Then we went to Liverpool St station where I attempted to impress him by telling him it was where Mansun filmed Taxloss. Again, it failed! Then I suprised him by taking him to Kings Cross and showing him where bits of Harry Potter were filmed. He wasn't as impressed as I'd hoped but definately appreciated the effort. Then we headed to Camden. Lunch was had and record shopping started. We spent many hours flicking through racks of vinyls, cds and going through the many many markets. After we'd tired ourselves out shopping we headed to Whetherspoons for a lovely meal. Then we went to Tottenham Court Road and spen the remaining half an hour in Virgin awaiting Karen and Nala. When they arrived we quickly found our seats in the Dominion Theatre. The Queen musical was also ABSOLUTELY FUCKING STUNNING!!!!!!! The plot line would probably sound stupid if I tried to explain it here so I won't. It was so much fun though, especially the parts where it turns into a giant sing-a-long! As I'll never get to experience the wonder of Queen live, I'm making the most of this as it's the closest I'll ever get. Friday and it was Scott's birthday! We got up about 2pm and he opened his cards and pressies. We went to town and bought a few bits before going back to Karen's flat. That evening was his suprise party. Although not nearly as many people showed as I'd hoped for he still had a good time. We got the people in Pizza Hut to bring out his brthday cake with candles on after our meal and he got all embarssed as we sang happy birthday (he buried his head in his arms on the table - bless!) After the meal we came back to our house and Scott had a few drinks. Then the conversation got on a bit of a downer so we excused ourselves and snuggled on Shelley's bed watching Friends videos. Saturday came and we got up late and made Scott's easyboy t-shirt which fucked up so he left it here. Then we went to London and joined the others for a picnic in Soho Square Garden. After about an hour we started feeling a bit left out so we headed for a pub. We had a drink there and then decided to go to Whetherspoons where many many drinks were consumed along with some nice food. At 9.30 we left for Stay Beautiful. Navigated the tubes successfully (only just due to drunkenness.) Scott seemed to enjoy SB, I spotted him dancing and singing along to a few songs. I really enjoyed it too, got up and danced on the podium with Nicky, Richey and Adz for a few songs which was great fun. We got in at about 2 after meeting Karen at the station and me and Scott went straight to bed as we were exhausted. Sunday we got up late, went for a meal and then Scott left. I cried lots and then Karen made a cake and we had lots and lots of fun! See - told you it was long! Am currently really looking forward to this Thursday when I get to stay at Scott's house again! Yay!

So we're back from Scott's parents a day later than planned due to the shops we wanted in Lincoln being shut.  We have returned with goodies that I will leave Scott to show off about.  
Had a great Easter weekend doing...well... very little really.  We got to Lincoln at lunchtime on Saturday, got some food and went to the market to see his mum and dad.  Chatted for a while then went for a look round the town.  We went to the Cathedral and castle where it was stupidly windy, saw the Roman well and Scott's fave pub and various other sights of Lincoln.  Went to a record fair too but didn't get anything.  When we'd finished we drove to Scott's parents' house where we were well fed and we all settled down watching the re-make of Planet of the Apes.  It was good but not as good as the original.  Elliot was lovely, even though Scott did insist on attacking him on random occasions.
Sunday we went to the shops to buy some things but they were all shut so we decided to stay overnight and go today.  Had gorgeous Sunday lunch courtesy of Scott's mum then we all vegged out on the sofa with the Grand Prix for the afternoon.  In the evening we dragged up some energy and went to the Railway social club for a drink.  There it was decided to visit Scott's auntie Diane and her sons Jonathan (13) and Matthew (8) who proceeded to beat Scott spectacularly at a board game, much to the amusement of the rest of us as Scott moaned his way through the game.  We were given chocolate before heading back to his mum and dad's house. They went straight to bed but me and Scott stayed up watching TV for an hour or so (he's allowed to stay up late now he's a big boy!)
Today we got up, went to the shops then headed back home.  Not particularly interesting. Was a brilliant weekend though!  Highlights were:

The Brown Family Portrait (that's a great shirt Scott's wearing!)
The kiddie photos and Scott's mum's attempts to get the albums out, only failing due to Scott's desperate protesting!
Scott repeatedly being told off by his mum for annoying Elliot when he was asleep.

Will go off and leave you all now, hope you've all had good Easter's too!
Love ever,
xxx

In the next hour or so we shall be setting off for Lincoln and tonight I shall be meeting Scott's parents.  Nervous doesn't begin to cover it!  I'm sure it will be fine though as I have been assured by both Scott and Vikki that they are lovely.  Vikki thinks she will be disowned and replaced by me and soon as their dad realises I'm a Queen fan anayway!  And I get to meet Elliot the cat too which I'm looking forward to as I love cats.
Love ever,
xxx

I've just had my heart broken.  
My sister moved house a few months ago and never told me.  I've just found out today.  Add that to the way she never replies to my texts or emails and you get a pretty clear picture of what's happening.  I've lost her and my neice and my brother-in-law too.  I've lost them!!!!  I can't cope with this.  My neice Izzy made me the happiest I'd ever been and now I've lost her forever.  I don't know what to do.  I can't live knowing that she's out there and I can't see them.  I knew they didn't want me around and that everyone was lying to me.  I knew it!
I hate myself.

I just found out Cerys Matthews is playing the Union Chapel!  She's got a few more dates lined up across the country too, I can't wait!  The new album's out on May 19th so I'll have to make sure I have plenty of cash that week as I'm getting a train to Manc for Radiohead that week too!  So much fun!
I'm going to a gig tonight.  Scott came home from work with tickets yesterday.  The headline are called The Burn who I've never heard of but we're going for the support.  They are Bell X A, Damien Rice's old band.  Scott played me their album last night and it's really pretty so the gig should be highly enjoyable.  He also came home with both cds of Athlete - El Salvadore for me because he's a sweetheart. *hugs Scott lots*
It's not fair that he has to go to work today.  The weather's really nice and we could've gone out into town and sat in the sunshine together.  He so didn't wanna get up today, ended up leaving late because he just couldn't drag himself up. :(  Meh.  At least he's only gotta do it one more time then 10 days off!!!
I had the most horrific nightmare I can ever remember having last night.  It was that someone called me and told me my grandad was dying and that I should call my mum and sister to see what was happening.  So I did and they told me that he was in huge amounts of pain and being taken to the hospital for an overdose of morphine.  Then they told me not to come over cos he didn't want to see me again and they didn't want me there.  That was what made it so bad cos I've had dreams of people dying before.  I woke up in floods of tears at about 5am.  Scott cuddled me tightly until I fell asleep again.  Weirdly he was cuddling me while I was on the phone in my nightmare too.  Even my subconcious knows I can rely on him!
Looking forward to seeing the northern boarders on Friday and having much fun and frolicks in the Trafford Centre together.
Love ever,
xxx
If anyone is really affluent and wants me to love them more than anything for ever and ever... Pretty Please? London date??? No, thought not!!!! :op xxx

I've just had my dinner and am debating dessert.  There's a rather tempting box of animal biscuits in the cupboard...  Should I????
xxx

I know I should be revising and when Scott reads this he'll shout at me for not working but I had too much energy and needed to do something to get rid of it before I could settle down and get on with anything. We've been having a lovely time together so far. Scott's sister is lovely and seemed to really like me which is always good. Her boyfriend is also lovely, in fact the whole group we went out with on Saturday were great people. I was highly amused by a bloke called Speedy (an old school friend of Scott and Simon's,) simply because he was called Speedy! Other than that night and going to Moonies on Friday, we haven't really done much. Highlight of yesterday was going to Morrisons for food. I bet you can hardly control yourselves from the excitement eh? Well we've been enjoying each others company too much to even notice that we're not doing much. We finalised our Easter weekend plans yesterday. Friday we're going to the Trafford Centre for the day because Scott's not been there yet and I wanna go to the fairy princess shop and try and drag him on the dodgems. Looking forward to going to the food court there. For anyone who's not been there, it's designed like the front of the Titanic and has a big pool in the middle. Tis one of my favourite places to eat! Saturday we're going to Lincoln. Scott's gonna take me around and show me where he grew up: old school, childhood house etc. We're going to his parents' market stall and anywhere else interesting he can think to take me. We're staying over with his mum and dad Saturday night and spending Sunday with them. Scott's crawling for a free meal and wants his birthday presents. We're also gonna hopefully see Moonies in Nottingham on Sunday night because Ryan said if I texted him that day he'd guestlist us and I trust him for some reason. Hopefully we should have a good time anyway! Well I'll be off and start working! Love ever, xxx Ps, We have Cava (Champaigne that hasn't been grown in the Champaigne region of France for those who don't know wines,) and strawberrys in the fridge! ;)
